page.title: 15WILKINSON'S MILL
page.content: The mill is an old windmill with its sail removed and is on the A161 road in Haxey.The mill was built in 1811.Mr Wilkinson has owned the mill since 1950.Alltogether there is one person working full time and some part time workers.Mrs Wilkinson is the person working full time.She keeps all the books and keeps their accounts up to date.The mill doesn't grind flour any more but they buy it off larger mills and then sell it.They sell animal foods which they make themselves.These are some of the prices of their animal food - pig food Â£168.30 per ton pig fattening Â£174. per ton laying food for hens Â£177.60 per ton cattle food Â£165.60 per ton beef fattening Â£154. per ton The flour is Â£10.04 for 32 kilo. The mill does three processes they are mixing,rolling and grinding.
